visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing linear progression with axis interruptions using Highcharts' broken-axis module and synthetic sequential data
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains univariate sequential values (n=30) showing perfect linear progression (y=x). Synthetic data maintains mathematical precision with μ=14.5 and σ=8.63 across the 0-29 range. Axis breaks between 5-10 (repeating every 10 units) create controlled data omission while preserving pattern recognition. The line chart maximizes data-ink ratio per Tufte by eliminating gridlines and redundant markings. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through: 1) Color contrast between red series and light background 2) Progressive label sizing (axis titles > values) 3) Positional consistency in break patterns. The broken axis technique visually acknowledges data gaps without interpolation, maintaining analytical integrity for interrupted measurement scenarios common in longitudinal studies.
